titleStmt.title: The vanity and impiety of judicial astrology whereby men undertake to foretell future contingencies, especially the particular fates of mankind, by the knowledge of the stars, i.e. the conjunctions, motions, positions and influences of the cœlestial bodies on the earthly / by Francis Crow.
titleStmt.author: Crow, Francis, d. 1692.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
